items.title: IMS pager download all of the content, not just one page data
items.body:
My team members recognized, that the pager function in the ..\IMS\ download all of the contents in the fist time, and just the frontend show it in little packs. 
It means, that many thousand of content maybe will kill this function. 
Our suggestion is the backend download just little packs, which the frontend needs. 

For the testing here you are some testuser import file sample. 
[testusers.csv.txt](https://github.com/SenseNet/sn-webpages/files/1600839/testusers.csv.txt)

items.title: Search page is missing
items.body:
When you enter a search phrase into the search box in the top right corner in any of the _workspaces_ (the one with the placeholder text 'Search site' or 'Search workspace'), you get an error message:

> Unknown action. Action: Search

This is because there is **no Search app/page in SN7 yet**.

The reason this issue is here and not in the [sn-workspaces](https://github.com/sensenet/sn-workspaces) repo is that the error is caused by the **ContextSearch** portlet (which is here): that is what tries to load the Search action and redirect to it.

The simpliest solution is to port the Search page from the old BP branch (or from SN6) here. We should check that page: what portlets are on it, which page template it uses, etc. If it is ok, we should move it here.

items.title: Two-digit component versions are not accepted
items.body:
Currently it is not possible to release a component (e.g. Services) with a **2-digit version number** (e.g. *7.1*). The 3-digit version, *7.1.0* works correctly. The install process concludes with success, the error happens in the _SnComponent.IsComponentAllowed_ method when you try to start the portal. Version comparison fails, because if the value 7.1 comes from the db, the version parser fills the 3rd segment (the Build number) with **-1 instead of 0**.

### Solution
We should probably simply treat these -1 values as zeros.

items.title: Actions menu does not work on Content Types
items.body:
When in Content Explorer (or an OData call from the client) I try to open the **Actions menu** (on the toolbar above the grid) **on a content type**, I receive the following error:

> Unknown action. Action: SmartAppGetActions

Reason: the necessary action is defined for the GenericContent items, but not for content types.

### Solution
Copy the action above from the _/Root/(apps)/GenericContent_ folder to the _/Root/(apps)/ContentType_ folder so that it becomes available to content types as well.

items.title: Refactor/separate lucene29
items.body:
- [x] convert the generic Search project to a nuget package so that other projects (like Lucene29 projects) can reference it **without having to reference the Services dlls**.
- [x] change _project_ references to the Search project in Lucene29 projects to _nuget_ references
- [x] extend Lucene29 projects with nuget nuspec files so that they can be published separately
- [x] add package dependencies to the Lucene29 Local package to the main **Services Install package config file**, so that the Lucene29 packages will be installed when a developer install Services - but **without a hard reference** (the same way as the security EF6 provider is included).
- [x] remove Lucene29 projects from the main solution and move them to a [separate repo](https://github.com/SenseNet/sn-search-lucene29)

items.title: Permission overview does not work for content types
items.body:
On the **Permission overview** page it is not possible to open and click tree elements under the _/Root/System/Schema/ContentTypes_ folder. The reason is that there are (at least) two **missing applications** in the repository for the _ContentType_ type.

- GetChildrenPermissionInfo
- GetPermissionOverview

**Solution**: copy them from the _GenericContent_ folder (they are here, in this repo, this is why this issue was created here and not in WebPages).

### Acceptance
- [ ] the content type subtree can be seen in the tree and the permissions on the types can be seen in the details panel as well.

items.title: Move and allowed child types
items.body:
_Node.GetChildTypesToAllow_ is called from the MoveTo operation. There are multiple problems with this:

- the stored procedure _proc_LoadChildTypesToAllow_ is _possibly_ incorrect, it uses _IN (Folder, Page)_ instead of _NOT IN (Folder, Page)_
- Move operation probably should not even check these allowed child types. Decide what should we do about checking allowed types during moving of a **whole subtree**.

items.title: Incorrect portlet dll name in import files
items.body:
Workflow portlet import files contain an incorrect (old) library name: _SenseNet.CorePortlets_. This prevents portal builders add workflow portlets to pages.

The correct name is: **SenseNet.Workflow.Portlets**

Folder to fix files in: _/src/nuget/snadmin/install-workflow/import-pages/Portlets/Workflow_
 
https://github.com/SenseNet/sn-workflow/tree/master/src/nuget/snadmin/install-workflow/import-pages/Portlets/Workflow

items.title: Builds fail because of incorrect security dll reference
items.body:
There is a problem with the _EF6SecurityProvider_ reference or package that causes one or more demo site builds to fail: the version of the dll and package is **2.3.0.0** and the project templates previously referred to the library in the local package folder with the same name (*2.3.0.0*) - but that caused service site builds to fail. After changing references to point to folder *2.3.0*, the internal test site build failed.

We have to determine the correct package folder and set references in the [sn-vs-projecttemplates](https://github.com/sensenet/sn-vs-projecttemplates) repo.

items.title: 'New' scenario returns only the 'File creator' actions through odata
items.body:
On the old admin surface if I open the 'New' action menu in a user profiles doclib the followings are listed:
- Empty document.docx
- Empty presentation.pptx
- Empty text document.txt
- Empty workbook.xslx
- Folder
- Smart Folder
- and only for admin users System Folder

![newmenu](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6968860/34941645-e44f1e44-f9f4-11e7-922f-541f3e79ce66.png)

So the list above is the expected response of a /Action?scenario=New request.

But if you send a /Actions?scenario=New request on the same doclib through OData only the followings are in the response:
- Empty document.docx
- Empty presentation.pptx
- Empty text document.txt
- Empty workbook.xslx

[link](https://dmsservice.demo.sensenet.com/odata.svc/content(4490)/Actions?scenario=New&metadata=no&$inlinecount=allpages)

items.title: Review unimplemented permission query parameters
items.body:
There are some permission action parameters that (based on some code comments) seems to be unimplemented for a while. Based on the generated client code, they are required for action calls. We should talk about cleaning up this API by removing these or at least making them optional with a default parameter.

The actions and their parameters are the following:

**GetRelatedIdentities**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet.

**GetRelatedPermissions**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet
 - explicitOnly - The value "true" is required because "false" is not implemented yet.

**GetRelatedItems**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet
 - explicitOnly - The value "true" is required because "false" is not implemented yet.

**GetRelatedIdentitiesByPermissions**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet

**GetRelatedItemsOneLevel**
 - level - The value is "AllowedOrDenied". "Allowed" or "Denied" are not implemented yet
